result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle Jennifer Nicole Halsey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond in the amount of $350.00 applied to Restitution. Balance of $437.99 to be paid during the period of probation at the rate of no less than $25.00 per month commencing February 1, 2016.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to enroll in no less than 12 credits at a Technical College beginning with the Spring 2016 semester OR during the period of probation the defendant obtains a cosmotology license.
Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with J. McCain, G. Stoddart, and/or D. Sonkowsky.
Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.

Defendant to complete an Anger Management Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Danielle Jennifer Nicole Halsey
Current: 53 Daffodil Lane, Tigerton, WI 54486 United States  (Effective: 12-09-2015)
Prior: 5146 Anton Dr, Apt 106, c/o Patricia Robinson, Fitchburg, WI 53719 United States

11:19 am case called. Defendant Danielle Jennifer Nicole Halsey in court with attorney Andrew John Sulewski.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on record by ADA Anderson. Attorney Sulewski concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 2 & 3. Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding expunction. Statement by Attorney Sulewski regarding expunction. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: Restitution of $787.99 to be paid in increments of no less than $25.00 per month commencing February 1, 2016. Anger Management Program and follow through. Defendant is to enroll in no less than 12 credits at a Technical College beginning with the Spring 2016 semester or During the period of probation will obtain a comsotology license. No Contact with victims as named in the complaint-J. McCain, G. Stoddart, &/or D. Sonkowsky. Terms of Agent. Court will allow expungement upon successful completion. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Bond to be applied.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP receivede and entered.   DA argues for $350 Cash Bond w/conditions.
